intro: Hypericum bupleuroides, commonly known as yellow archangel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically bright green and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Due to its attractive foliage and flowers, it is a popular choice for garden cultivation.
